src:
Penguasa Motor Disebut Absen di Pameran Motor Akhir November
06 Nov 2019, 07:56 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi pameran sepeda motor. (Foto: CNN Indonesia/Hesti Rika)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Pameran otomotif roda dua, Indonesia Internasional Motor Show (IIMS) Motobike Expo yang digelar mulai 29 November sampai 1 Desember 2019 di Istora Senayan, Jakarta disebut tidak akan diikuti penguasa pasar roda dua dalam negeri,Â Astra Honda Motor (AHM).Dyandra Promosindo selaku penyelenggara mengaku tidak mempermasalahkan AHM absen di acara yang baru akan diselenggarakan perdana tahun ini. Kendati demikian penyelenggara terpuaskan dengan keikutsertaan sejumlah merek global lain, yaitu Benelli, BMW Motorrad, Cleveland, Husqvarna, Kawasaki, KTM, Peugeot, Piaggio, Vespa, dan Yamaha.Selain Honda, merek sepeda motor di Tanah Air lain yang belum memutuskan ikut pameran tersebut yaitu Suzuki."Ya ini saja udah untung kami," kata Project Director IIMS Motobike Expo Hendra Noor Saleh di kawasan SCBD, Jakarta Selatan, Selasa (5/11).Pria yang akrab disapa Kohen ini mengatakan negosiasi telah dilakukan antara pihak penyelenggara dan kedua pabrikan motor, namun masih menemui jalan buntu karena kedua perusahaan masih diskusi di internal mereka."Ya belum final, bisa iya atau tidak. Saya sudah nawarin ke mereka. Katanya masih diskusi," ucap Kohen.AHM sampai saat ini belum merespons terkait ketidakhadiran di pameran motor tersebut.Berdasarkan data Asosiasi Industri Sepeda Motor Indonesia (AISI), AHM masih menjadi produsen roda dua terlaris di Indonesia. Penjualan 'kuda besi' sepanjang 2018, dari lima anggota AISI yang mencapai 6,3 juta unit, AHM mampu menguasai 74,6 persen pangsa pasar atau sebesar 4.759.202 unit. Kemudian Suzuki menempati posisi ketiga penjualan sepeda motor terlaris setelah Yamaha (89.508 unit).Target Penjualan Motor Selama PameranIIMS Motobike Expo yang diselenggarakan selama tiga hari menargetkan penjualan sekitar 1.000 unit atau total transaksi mencapai Rp25 miliar. Kohen optimistis target tersebut bisa tercapai meskipun tanpa kehadiran AHM dan Suzuki.Kohen meyakini target penjualan selama pameran berlangsung akan tercapai sebab banyak model motor terbaru yang ditawarkan masing-masing exhibitor. Banyaknya model baru ini setidaknya menarik pengunjung untuk melakukan transaksi pembelian unit baru.Kohen menambahkan, selain menanti keputusan dua merek Jepang, pihaknya juga sedang menunggu kepastian dari pemanufaktur motor listrik lokal, yaitu Gesits untuk berpartisipasi dalam pameran. Keikutsertaan Gesits diakui bakal memberi warna pameran roda dua."Kami ada Gesits tapi juga masih menunggu keputusan," tutup Kohen. (ryh/mik)
text:
Motorcycle Ruler Called Absent at the Motor Show End of November
Nov 6, 2019, 07:56 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of a motorcycle exhibition. (Photo: CNN Indonesia / Hesti Rika)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The two-wheeled automotive exhibition, the Indonesia International Motor Show (IIMS) Motobike Expo, which will be held from November 29 to December 1, 2019 at Istora Senayan, Jakarta will not be followed by the domestic two-wheeler market leader, Astra Honda Motor (AHM) ). Daniandra Promosindo, as the organizer, admitted that she did not mind AHM's absence at the new event which will be held this year. Nevertheless the organizer was satisfied with the participation of a number of other global brands, namely Benelli, BMW Motorrad, Cleveland, Husqvarna, Kawasaki, KTM, Peugeot, Piaggio, Vespa, and Yamaha. "Yes, this is just us," said IIMS Motobike Expo Project Director Hendra Noor Saleh in the SCBD area, South Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5). The man, who is familiarly called Kohen, said negotiations had been carried out between the organizers and the two motorcycle manufacturers, but still deadlocked because the two companies are still discussing in their internal. "Yes not yet final, can be yes or no. I have offered to them. He said still in discussion," said Kohen. AHM until now has not responded related to the absence in motorcycle exhibition. Based on data from the Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI), AHM is still the best-selling two-wheeler manufacturer in Indonesia. Sales of 'iron horses' throughout 2018, from five AISI members reaching 6.3 million units, AHM was able to control 74.6 percent of the market share or as much as 4,759,202 units. Then Suzuki ranked third in the best-selling motorcycle sales after Yamaha (89,508 units). Target Motorcycle Sales During the IMIM Motobike Expo exhibition which was held for three days targeted sales of around 1,000 units or total transactions reaching Rp25 billion. Kohen is optimistic that the target can be achieved even without the presence of AHM and Suzuki. Kohen believes sales targets during the exhibition will be achieved because many of the latest motorcycle models offered by each exhibitor. The many new models at least attract visitors to make purchases of new units. Kohen added, in addition to waiting for the decision of two Japanese brands, it was also waiting for certainty from local electric motor manufacturers, namely Gesits to participate in the exhibition. The participation of Gesits is acknowledged to give the color of the two-wheeled exhibition. "We have Gesits but we are still awaiting a decision," Kohen concluded. (ryh / mic)
